pynav.filters¶

Functions:

check_outlier

Performs the Normalized-Innovation-Squared (NIS) test to identify an outlier.

run_filter

Executes a predict-correct-style filter given lists of input and measurement data.

Classes:

ExtendedKalmanFilter

On-manifold nonlinear Kalman filter.

IteratedKalmanFilter

On-manifold iterated extended Kalman filter.
pynav.filters.check_outlier(error: numpy.ndarray, covariance: numpy.ndarray)¶

Performs the Normalized-Innovation-Squared (NIS) test to identify an outlier.

class pynav.filters.ExtendedKalmanFilter(process_model: pynav.types.ProcessModel, reject_outliers=False)¶

Bases: object

On-manifold nonlinear Kalman filter.

Parameters

  • process_model (ProcessModel) – process model to be used in the prediction step

  • reject_outliers (bool, optional) – whether to apply the NIS test to measurements, by default False

process_model¶
reject_outliers¶
predict(x: pynav.types.StateWithCovariance, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, dt: Optional[float] = None, x_jac: Optional[pynav.types.State] = None) → pynav.types.StateWithCovariance¶

Propagates the state forward in time using a process model.

Parameters

  • x (StateWithCovariance) – The current state estimate.

  • u (StampedValue) – Input measurement to be given to process model

  • dt (float, optional) – Duration to next time step. If not provided, the .stamp value in u will be used.

  • x_jac (State, optional) – Evaluation point for the process model Jacobian. If not provided, the current state estimate will be used.

  • use_last_input (bool, optional) –

    Whether to use the previously-fed input in the process model or the current one, by default True. This is essentially the difference between

Returns

New predicted state

Return type

StateWithCovariance

correct(x: pynav.types.StateWithCovariance, y: pynav.types.Measurement, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, x_jac: Optional[pynav.types.State] = None, reject_outlier: Optional[bool] = None) → pynav.types.StateWithCovariance¶

Fuses an arbitrary measurement to produce a corrected state estimate.

Parameters

  • x (StateWithCovariance) – The current state estimate.

  • u (StampedValue) – Most recent input, to be used if the measurement stamp is larger than the state stamp.

  • y (Measurement) – Measurement to be fused into the current state estimate.

  • x_jac (State, optional) – valuation point for the process model Jacobian. If not provided, the current state estimate will be used.

  • reject_outlier (bool, optional) – Whether to apply the NIS test to this measurement, by default None

Returns

The corrected state estimate

Return type

StateWithCovariance

  • reject_outliers (bool, optional) – whether to apply the NIS test to measurements, by default False

reject_outliers¶
correct(x: pynav.types.StateWithCovariance, y: pynav.types.Measurement, u: pynav.types.StampedValue, x_jac: Optional[pynav.types.State] = None, reject_outlier=None)¶

Fuses an arbitrary measurement to produce a corrected state estimate.

Parameters

  • x (StateWithCovariance) – The current state estimate.

  • u (StampedValue) – Most recent input, to be used if the measurement stamp is larger than the state stamp.

  • y (Measurement) – Measurement to be fused into the current state estimate.

  • x_jac (State, optional) – valuation point for the process model Jacobian. If not provided, the current state estimate will be used.

  • reject_outlier (bool, optional) – Whether to apply the NIS test to this measurement, by default None

Returns

The corrected state estimate

Return type

StateWithCovariance
